title: Strategy
text: Represent GWAS summary data multiple sources various different shapes different tools Represent class structure packages can call dependencies Ensure harmonisation data across different sources able simulate data ease analytical prototyping Store relevant meta data methods visualising, joining subsetting datasets Create examples analytical tools creating methods import gwasglue2 package. example ‘structures’ summary datasets able handle

title: Strategy
text: Data structures Note whole OpenGWAS database example ‘complete’ dataset - traits variants. typically want represent gwasglue2 specific slice data, almost always going rectangular shape - set variants across set traits. addition, need able able flexibly associate metadata forms annotations (LD matrices, genomic annotations etc) data. Finally, analytical tools need aware structures order easily deploy methods upon .

title: Strategy
text: typically workflow might look: Work flow able ingest data various locations, class provides number different ways manipulate annotate data.

title: Strategy
text: set genetic associations (1 ) single trait known SummarySet. class contain data, plus MetaData describes source study, plus list Concepts annotate Summary data. Concept named list extra information can linked data, example LD matrices, annotations relating use data model (e.g. exposure outcome), etc. Dataset set merged harmonised SummarySets, example two SummarySets generated using set variants two traits, putting together Dataset find intersect available variants, harmonise effect allele. Dataset objects can also global Concept list extra data common across SummarySets stored object. Initial visualisation : Class structures

title: Strategy
text: Currently planning implement S4 class, may move R7 future stable compatible roxygen etc.

title: Strategy
text: Association data within SummarySet following fields - chromosome position effect allele (ALT) non-effect allele (REF) effect size standard error p-value effect allele frequency rsid imputation info score sample size number cases number controls Metadata fields - genome build units effect size number cases number controls trait name trait identifier ancestral population sample sex sample study DOI number variants Ontology term standard deviation trait mean trait genotyping method analysis method covariates notes Accession info generated upon creation: Data source Timestamp access Query

title: Tutorial
text: perform MR analysis body mass index (exposure - ieu--2) coronary heart disease (outcome - ieu--7). Obtain data Obtain metadata create metadata object Construct Summary Sets set tool metadata (uses ieugwasr::gwasinfo() source id arguments) Set MR labels summary sets Check Metadata MR labels Create DataSet object Convert dataset TwoSampleMR format Perform MR analysis
code: x <- ieugwasr::tophits("ieu-a-2")$rsid d1 <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = x, id = "ieu-a-2") d2 <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = x, id = "ieu-a-7") m1 <- ieugwasr::gwasinfo( "ieu-a-2") m2 <- ieugwasr::gwasinfo( "ieu-a-7") meta1 <-create_metadata(m1) meta2 <-create_metadata(m2) sumset1 <- create_summaryset(d1, metadata=meta1) sumset2 <- create_summaryset(d2, metadata=meta2) sumset1 <-setMRlabel(sumset1, mr_label = "exposure") sumset2 <-setMRlabel(sumset2, mr_label = "outcome") getMetadata(sumset1) getMRlabel(sumset1)  getMetadata(sumset2) getMRlabel(sumset2) dataset <- DataSet(sumset1,sumset2) %>%   overlapVariants(., strand = "forward") %>%   harmoniseData(.,tolerance = 0.08, action = 1) dataset_mr <- convertForTwoSampleMR(dataset) mr_result <-  merge(getData(dataset_mr,1),getData(dataset_mr,2), by = c("SNP", "mr_keep"))  %>%   TwoSampleMR::mr(., method_list="mr_ivw")  mr_result

title: Tutorial
text: need first define genomic range analysis performed. known LD block chromosome 22 (build hg19) need scan OpenGWAS traits significant associations region First set path reference population plink files located build LD matrix. obtain data Next, trait need perform finemapping. involve using SusieR identify credible sets region trait, generate conditional summary datasets credible set. Explanation: Credible set: trait inferred e.g. 3 causal variants genomic region 3 credible sets. credible set essentially cluster SNPs close , include 1 SNPs candidates causal variant. Conditional summary datasets: credible sets identified, can try estimate summary data results looked like credible set accounting credible sets. example 3 conditional summary datasets, single peak different location. Use susieR generate credible sets dataset (e.g. 1, 1. least 1 selected association region) TODO: Explain marginalise summarysets using susieR Approximate Bayes Factors. summary sets harmonised, marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Now going merge datasets. Note merge_datasets() function just going merge marginalised datasets. Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. (Use fork hypercoloc allows dataset object provided) Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets NOTE: example colocalisation.
code: genomicrange <- "22:43714200-44995307" id_list <- ieugwasr::phewas(pval = 5e-6, variants=genomicrange, batch="ukb-a")$id %>%   unique() #ld_ref <- "/project/data/reference/ld/EUR" ld_ref <- "data/ld/EUR" # Get GWAS summary statistics data <- lapply(seq_along(id_list), function(i){     s <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = genomicrange, id = id_list[i]) })  # get metadata and create metadata objects metadata <- lapply(seq_along(id_list), function(i){   m <- create_metadata(ieugwasr::gwasinfo(id_list[i]))  })   # create gwasglue2 DataSet object    dataset <- create_dataset(data, metadata = metadata, tools = c("finemap","coloc"), harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1) %>%    harmonise_ld(., ld_ref = ld_ref, bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") # do finemapping with susie ntraits <- getLength(dataset) dataset_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(dataset), summaryset = getSummarySet(dataset, trait)) }) dataset_marginalised <- merge_datasets(dataset_marginalised) res_dataset <- hyprcoloc(dataset = dataset)  #hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input print(res_dataset) res_dataset_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset = dataset_marginalised) print(res_dataset_marginalised)

title: Tutorial2
text: ’ll analyse following traits (chd - cardiac heart disease; ldl - low-density lipoprotein; hdl - high-density lipoprotein; trig - triglycerides t2d - type 2 diabetes) around different genes. First set path reference population plink files located build LD matrix choose data trait set IEU IDs. create metadata objects trait objects (going use genes).
code: remotes::install_github('ritarasteiro/hyprcoloc', build_opts = c('--resave-data', '--no-manual'), build_vignettes = TRUE)  remotes::install_github('ritarasteiro/susieR') #library(gwasglue2) devtools::load_all("../") # this was added just for development library(susieR)     # fork that takes Summaryset library(hyprcoloc)  # fork that takes Dataset #ld_ref <- "/project/data/reference/ld/EUR" ld_ref <- "../data/ld/EUR" chd_id <- "ieu-a-7" ldl_id <- "ieu-b-110" hdl_id <- "ieu-b-109" trig_id <- "ieu-b-111" t2d_id <- "ebi-a-GCST006867" ids <- c(chd_id, ldl_id, hdl_id, trig_id, t2d_id) # get metadata and create metadata objects metadata <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){   m <- create_metadata(ieugwasr::gwasinfo(ids[i]))  })

title: Tutorial2
text: start creating gwasglue 2 DataSet object harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix starting fine mapping colocalisation analyses, going look p-values variant trait. summary sets harmonised, marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Now going merge datasets. Note merge_datasets() function just going merge marginalised datasets. Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. (Use fork hypercoloc allows dataset object provided) Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets
code: # Get GWAS summary statistics hmgcr_chrpos <- "5:74132993-75132993" hmgcr_data <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){     s <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = hmgcr_chrpos, id = ids[i]) })   # create a gwasglue2 DataSet object (hmgcr) hmgcr <- create_dataset(hmgcr_data, metadata = metadata, tools = c("finemap","coloc"), harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1,strand= "forward") %>%    harmonise_ld(., ld_ref = ld_ref, bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") # plot gwasglue2 DataSet object (hmgcr)  plot_gwasglue(hmgcr, type="manhattan", title = "HMGCR") # do finemapping with susie ntraits <- getLength(hmgcr) hmgcr_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(hmgcr), summaryset = getSummarySet(hmgcr, trait)) }) hmgcr_marginalised <- merge_datasets(hmgcr_marginalised) res_hmgcr <- hyprcoloc(dataset = hmgcr)  #hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input print(res_hmgcr) res_hmgcr_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset = hmgcr_marginalised) print(res_hmgcr_marginalised)

what: PCSK9 (proprotein convertase subtilisin/kexin type 9) gene region
title: Tutorial2
text: Create dataset harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix (note saving SummarySet objects separately, filling directly DataSet). Manhattan plots trait DataSet. Marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Merge marginalised datasets: Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets
code: # Get GWAS summary statistics pcsk9_chrpos <- "1:55005221-56005221" pcsk9_data <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){     s <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = pcsk9_chrpos, id = ids[i]) })   # create a gwasglue2 DataSet object pcsk9 <- create_dataset(pcsk9_data, metadata = metadata, tools = c("finemap","coloc"), harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1,strand= "forward") %>%    harmonise_ld(., ld_ref = ld_ref, bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") # plot gwasglue2 DataSet object (pcsk9)  plot_gwasglue(pcsk9, type="manhattan", title = "PCSK9") # do finemapping with susie  ntraits <- getLength(pcsk9) pcsk9_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(pcsk9), summaryset = getSummarySet(pcsk9, trait))  }) pcsk9_marginalised <- merge_datasets(pcsk9_marginalised) res_pcsk9 <- hyprcoloc(dataset = pcsk9) print(res_pcsk9) res_pcsk9_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset =pcsk9_marginalised) print(res_pcsk9_marginalised)

what: NPC1L1 (NPC1 like intracellular cholesterol transporter 1) gene region
title: Tutorial2
text: Create dataset harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix Manhattan plots trait DataSet. Marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Merge marginalised datasets: Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets
code: # Get GWAS summary statistics npc1l1_chrpos <- "7:44052134-45052134" npc1l1_data <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){     s <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = npc1l1_chrpos, id = ids[i]) })   # create a gwasglue2 DataSet object npc1l1 <- create_dataset(npc1l1_data, metadata = metadata, tools = c("finemap","coloc"), harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1,strand= "forward") %>%    harmonise_ld(., ld_ref = ld_ref, bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") # plot gwasglue2 DataSet object (npc1l1)  plot_gwasglue(npc1l1, type="manhattan", title ="NPC1L1") ntraits <- getLength( npc1l1) npc1l1_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(npc1l1), summaryset = getSummarySet( npc1l1, trait)) }) npc1l1_marginalised <- merge_datasets(npc1l1_marginalised) res_npc1l1 <- hyprcoloc(dataset = npc1l1) print(res_npc1l1) res_npc1l1_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset =npc1l1_marginalised) print(res_npc1l1_marginalised)

title: Tutorial2
text: Create dataset harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix Manhattan plots trait DataSet. Marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Merge marginalised datasets: Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets
code: # Get GWAS summary statistics lpa_chrpos <- "6:160952515-161087407" lpa_data <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){     s <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = lpa_chrpos, id = ids[i]) })   # create a gwasglue2 DataSet object lpa <- create_dataset(lpa_data, metadata = metadata, tools = c("finemap","coloc"), harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1,strand= "forward") %>%    harmonise_ld(., ld_ref = ld_ref, bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") # plot gwasglue2 DataSet object (lpa)  plot_gwasglue(lpa, type="manhattan", title = "LPA") ntraits <- getLength(lpa) lpa_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait) {   # Takes in 1 SS   # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)   ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(lpa), summaryset = getSummarySet(lpa, trait)) }) lpa_marginalised <- merge_datasets(lpa_marginalised) res_lpa <- hyprcoloc(dataset = lpa) print(res_lpa) res_lpa_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset = lpa_marginalised) print(res_lpa_marginalised)

title: Meta analysis
text: Meta-analysis statistical combination results two separate studies. gwasglue2, use fixed-effect model assumes one true effect size underlies studies meta-analysis. going perform meta-analysis two different studies cardiac heart disease (chd), HMGCR (3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-CoA reductase) gene region. Firt, choose IEU ids chd trait Obtain metadata create metadata object Create summary sets, followed dataset includes . Finally, perform meta-analysis create new summary set
code: #library(gwasglue2) devtools::load_all("../") # this was added just for development ids <- c( "ieu-a-7",  "ukb-d-I9_IHD") metadata <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){   m <- create_metadata(ieugwasr::gwasinfo(ids[i]))  }) #  create dataset    hmgcr_chrpos <- "5:74132993-75132993"   dataset <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){     # create summarysets     s <- create_summaryset(ieugwasr::associations(variants = hmgcr_chrpos, id =ids[i]), metadata=metadata[i])   }) %>%     # create dataset     create_dataset(., harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1) meta_chd <- dataset%>%    create_meta_summaryset(.)

code: if(!require("remotes")) {     install.packages("remotes") } remotes::install_github("MRCIEU/gwasglue2")

what: An S4 class to represent the Data Set — DataSet-class

text: S4 class represent Data Set

title: An S4 class to represent the Data Set — DataSet-class
text: summary_sets list SummarySet objects (default NA). overlap_variants among SummarySets is_resized logical (default FALSE). is_harmonised logical (default FALSE). overall_dropped_SNPs vector RSIDs removed summary_sets. dropped_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput (SNPs removed summary_sets ) palindromic_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput. ambiguous_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput. incompatible_alleles_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput. ld_matrix LD matrix buoild reference population is_harmonisedLD logical (default FALSE). zscores vector calculated z-scores susie_marginalised logical (default FALSE). susieR susieR::susie_rss() output is_converted logical (default FALSE).

title: A function to create a gwasglue2 SummarySet object — constructSummarySet
code: constructSummarySet(   data = tibble(),   id,   tools,   source = "IEUopenGWAS",   beta_col = "beta",   se_col = "se",   samplesize_col = "n",   pvalue_col = "p",   chr_col = "chr",   position_col = "position",   rsid_col = "rsid",   effect_allele_col = "ea",   other_allele_col = "nea",   eaf_col = "eaf",   id_col = "id",   trait_col = "trait" )

title: A function to create a gwasglue2 SummarySet object — constructSummarySet
text: data GWAS summary statistics. tibble id GWAS study ID tools Array methods gwasglue2 going convert summarySet (eg. "mr") source ID Data Source set DataSet @slot metadata (Default option: IEUopenGWAS). beta_col Name column effect sizes. default "beta". se_col Name column standard errors. default "se". samplesize_col Column name sample size. default "n". pvalue_col Name column p-value. default "p". chr_col Column name chromosome . default "chr". position_col Column name position. Together, @param chr gives physical coordinates variant. default "position". rsid_col Required name column variants rs IDs. default "rsid". effect_allele_col Name column effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "ea". other_allele_col Name column non effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "nea. eaf_col Name column effect allele frequency. default "eaf". id_col default "id". trait_col Column name column phenotype name corresponding variant. default "trait"

title: A function to create a gwasglue2 SummarySet object — constructSummarySet

code: createDataSet(   data = list(),   ids,   tools,   source = "IEUopenGWAS",   harmonise = TRUE,   tolerance = 0.08,   action = 1,   strand = "forward",   beta_col = "beta",   se_col = "se",   samplesize_col = "n",   pvalue_col = "p",   chr_col = "chr",   position_col = "position",   rsid_col = "rsid",   effect_allele_col = "ea",   other_allele_col = "nea",   eaf_col = "eaf",   id_col = "id",   trait_col = "trait" )

title: Creates a DataSet object and harmonise data against data — createDataSet
text: data list gwasglue2 SummarySet objects ids ID GWAS studies query tools Array methods gwasglue2 going convert summarySet (eg. "mr") source ID Data Source set DataSet @slot metadata (Default option: IEUopenGWAS). harmonise logical (default TRUE). harmonises summary sets DataSet . tolerance Inherited harmoniseData() (default 0.08) action Inherited harmoniseData() (Default 1) strand dna strand orientation  (Default "forward", option "reverse") beta_col Name column effect sizes. default "beta". se_col Name column standard errors. default "se". samplesize_col Column name sample size. default "n". pvalue_col Name column p-value. default "p". chr_col Column name chromosome . default "chr". position_col Column name position. Together, @param chr gives physical coordinates variant. default "position". rsid_col Required name column variants rs IDs. default "rsid". effect_allele_col Name column effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "ea". other_allele_col Name column non effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "nea. eaf_col Name column effect allele frequency. default "eaf". id_col default "id". trait_col Column name column phenotype name corresponding variant. default "trait"

title: Creates a DataSet object using gwasglue2 SummarySet objects, and harmonise data against data — create_dataset
text: data list gwasglue2 SummarySet objects harmonise logical (default TRUE). harmonises summary sets DataSet . tolerance Inherited harmoniseData() (default 0.08) action Inherited harmoniseData() (Default 1) action = 1: Assume alleles coded forward strand, .e. attempt flip alleles action = 2: Try infer positive strand alleles, using allele frequencies palindromes (default, conservative); action = 3: Correct strand non-palindromic SNPs, drop palindromic SNPs analysis (conservative). strand dna strand orientation  (Default "forward", option "reverse")

title: Creates a DataSet object using gwasglue2 SummarySet objects, and harmonise data against data — create_dataset

title: Creates a DataSet object using GWAS summary statistics, and harmonise data against data — create_dataset_from_tibble
text: data list GWAS summary data (tibles) metadata list metadata information. NULL, creates metadata information retrieved dataset. harmonise logical (default TRUE). harmonises summary sets DataSet . tolerance Inherited harmoniseData() (default 0.08) action Inherited harmoniseData() (Default 1) action = 1: Assume alleles coded forward strand, .e. attempt flip alleles action = 2: Try infer positive strand alleles, using allele frequencies palindromes (default, conservative); action = 3: Correct strand non-palindromic SNPs, drop palindromic SNPs analysis (conservative). strand dna strand orientation  (Default "forward", option "reverse") beta_col Name column effect sizes. default "beta". se_col Name column standard errors. default "se". samplesize_col Column name sample size. default "n". pvalue_col Name column p-value. default "p". chr_col Column name chromosome . default "chr". position_col Column name position. Together, @param chr gives physical coordinates variant. default "position". rsid_col Required name column variants rs IDs. default "rsid". effect_allele_col Name column effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "ea". other_allele_col Name column non effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "nea. eaf_col Name column effect allele frequency. default "eaf". id_col default "id". trait_col Column name column phenotype name corresponding variant. default "trait" ... columns

what: A function to create a gwasglue2 SummarySet object — create_summaryset
title: A function to create a gwasglue2 SummarySet object — create_summaryset
text: function create gwasglue2 SummarySet object

title: A function to create a gwasglue2 SummarySet object — create_summaryset
code: create_summaryset(   data = tibble(),   metadata = NULL,   beta_col = "beta",   se_col = "se",   samplesize_col = "n",   pvalue_col = "p",   chr_col = "chr",   position_col = "position",   rsid_col = "rsid",   effect_allele_col = "ea",   other_allele_col = "nea",   eaf_col = "eaf",   id_col = "id",   trait_col = "trait",   ... )

title: A function to create a gwasglue2 SummarySet object — create_summaryset
text: data GWAS summary statistics. tibble metadata list metadata information. NULL, creates metadata information retrieved dataset beta_col Name column effect sizes. default "beta". se_col Name column standard errors. default "se". samplesize_col Column name sample size. default "n". pvalue_col Name column p-value. default "p". chr_col Column name chromosome . default "chr". position_col Column name position. Together, @param chr gives physical coordinates variant. default "position". rsid_col Required name column variants rs IDs. default "rsid". effect_allele_col Name column effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "ea". other_allele_col Name column non effect allele. Must contain characters "", "C", "T" "G". default "nea. eaf_col Name column effect allele frequency. default "eaf". id_col GWAS study ID column. default "id". trait_col Column name column phenotype name corresponding variant. default "trait" ... columns

what:
Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets
This is based o the harmonise function of TwoSampleMR — harmonise
title:
Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets
This is based o the harmonise function of TwoSampleMR — harmonise
text: Harmonise alleles effects two summary sets based o harmonise function TwoSampleMR

title:
Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets
This is based o the harmonise function of TwoSampleMR — harmonise
code: harmonise(rsid, A1, A2, B1, B2, betaA, betaB, fA, fB, tolerance, action)

title:
Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets
This is based o the harmonise function of TwoSampleMR — harmonise
text: action Level strictness dealing SNPs. action = 1: Assume alleles coded forward strand, .e. attempt flip alleles action = 2: Try infer positive strand alleles, using allele frequencies palindromes (default, conservative); action = 3: Correct strand non-palindromic SNPs, drop palindromic SNPs analysis (conservative).

what: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
text: Harmonise alleles effects two summary sets

title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
code: harmoniseData(object, tolerance, action)  # S4 method for DataSet harmoniseData(object, tolerance = 0.08, action = 2)

title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
text: object gwasglue2 DataSet object tolerance Tolerance value. action Level strictness dealing SNPs. action = 1: Assume alleles coded forward strand, .e. attempt flip alleles action = 2: Try infer positive strand alleles, using allele frequencies palindromes (default, conservative); action = 3: Correct strand non-palindromic SNPs, drop palindromic SNPs analysis (conservative).

title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
text: gwasglue2 DataSet object harmonised

title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
code: harmoniseData(object, tolerance, action, strand)

title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
text: object DataSet object tolerance Tolerance value. action Level strictness dealing SNPs. action = 1: Assume alleles coded forward strand, .e. attempt flip alleles action = 2: Try infer positive strand alleles, using allele frequencies palindromes (default, conservative); action = 3: Correct strand non-palindromic SNPs, drop palindromic SNPs analysis (conservative). strand dna strand orientation  (Default "forward", option "reverse")

what: Harmonise dat1 and dat2 for multivariable MR — mv_harmonise_data
title: Harmonise dat1 and dat2 for multivariable MR — mv_harmonise_data
text: Harmonise dat1 dat2 multivariable MR

title: Harmonise dat1 and dat2 for multivariable MR — mv_harmonise_data
code: mv_harmonise_data(dat1, dat2, harmonise_strictness = 2)

title: Harmonise dat1 and dat2 for multivariable MR — mv_harmonise_data
text: dat1 Output mv_extract_dat1s. dat2 Output extract_dat2a(dat1$rsid, id_output). harmonise_strictness See action option harmonise_data. default 2.

title: Harmonise dat1 and dat2 for multivariable MR — mv_harmonise_data
text: List vectors matrices required mv analysis. dat1_beta matrix beta coefficients, rows correspond SNPs columns correspond dat1s. dat1_se dat1_beta, standard errors. dat1_pval dat1_beta, p-values. expname data frame two variables, id.dat1 dat1 character strings. dat2_beta array effects dat2, corresponding SNPs dat1_beta. dat2_se array standard errors dat2. dat2_pval array p-values dat2. outname data frame two variables, id.dat2 dat2 character strings.
